text:
We need to do more to educate people about not tagging breaking changes for not breaking things.
Not to pick on Lasso in particular, but it is such an example of this.
<https://github.com/JuliaStats/Lasso.jl/releases>
v0.6.0 not only had no breaking changes, it had no user facing API changes at all.
It had an improved docstring, and a change to the tests, and changed the compat

text:
One idea might be to make the Registrator bot or Registry CI give extra notice if the change is breaking.
And be like “Are you sure?”
Maybe even request that someone post a list of reasons it is breaking that while it wouldn’t read, that tagbot could insert into the release notes.
